initial_question.title: animated-gif package breaks downloadable gifs with rounding
initial_question.body:
### Description

I'm using **com.facebook.fresco:fresco** and **com.facebook.fresco:animated-gif** for show animated gif.
I load a gif image (non animated) from the Internet and apply **RoundingParams**.  
I expect to see round image, but I get square.
Gifs from app resources work fine.
I need **animated-gif** package for animation, but how to disable it for non animated gifs?

### Reproduction

If enable **animated-gif** package then **RoundingParams** will broken but animation will worked fine.

### Solution

Disabling **animated-gif** package resolve problem, but all animated gifs break.

### Additional Information

* Fresco version: 2.0.0
* animated-gif: 2.0.0
* Platform version: any device

satisfaction_conditions: Non-animated GIF images must display with correct rounding when loaded
Animated GIF support must remain functional
Solution must work with remote images loaded from the internet
System must correctly differentiate between animated and non-animated GIFs

initial_question.title: How to set loopcount for AnimatedImage after v1.4.0?
initial_question.body:
Now I aim to play a gif image 5 time.
And I found there is  a method getLoopCount for get the number of loops for a  animatedImage, 
but the question is I don't know how to dynamic set loopCount.
Waiting for your help.

satisfaction_conditions: GIF animation plays a specified number of times (5 in this case)
Loop count can be modified programmatically after image loading
Animation control persists throughout the image lifecycle

initial_question.title: When trying to fetchImageFromBitmapCache() for GIF image, imageReference is always null
initial_question.body:
I want to allow users to save GIF images in our app. I am trying to get GIF image from Fresco cache via `fetchImageFromBitmapCache()` but it always returns NULL for GIF images.
For JPG and PNG images there is no problem.

satisfaction_conditions: GIF images must be successfully retrieved from cache
Animated image content must be handled differently from static images
Complete image data must be preserved for saving
Saved GIF files must be properly formatted and playable
Appropriate error handling must be implemented
